intro: Chamaelirium japonicum subsp. japonicum, commonly known as Japanese tasselflower, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a mild, aromatic scent. The subspecies japonicum is distinguished by its specific floral structure and habitat preferences compared to other members of the Chamaelirium genus.
